title: Why is it that in a game with over 120 champions and near endless customisation...
body: That every game feels the same, every game is the same played out snowbally crap every single time and its frustrating to play unless youre the one pubstomping, its gotten so bad that games are decided in 10 minutes and then youre in for 20 more minutes of torture thanks of the prick(s) on your team saying "we got late game" and refusing to surrender until the enemy team is in base destroying our nexus turrets. I could get over this stupid early game snowball meta if comebacks were possible but unless the enemy team misplays impossibly hard you're in for a bad time. I'm not sure about you guys but I've never had less fun playing LoL than I do at the moment, I hope pre-season fixes this or I'm probably finished. (For real this time)

replies.body:
I dont mind so much sloging through losing games, I see most games as winnable, and I for one learn more from playing a losing game than a winning one.

My problem with it is the champion diversity.
How come in a game with 140 champs, we only ever see 30 of them?

Mid lane has a 50% chance of being either Yasuo or Zed, a 30% chance of being a pro-copy-cat champ like Ori or Viktor, and a 20% chance of being any of the other 60 or so mid laners.

Once you've played the same Zed lane over and over and over, you get hella sick of it.
You know what's more frustrating? people nowawdays just play for 5 or 10 minutes and give up... they go afk, they fool around, they just try to go and tilt everyone... that's frustrating.
